3-If something feels off or makes you uncomfortable, trust your gut instincts.
4-Carry personal safety items like a whistle, pepper spray, or a personal alarm.
5-When using public transportation, wait in well-lit areas and be aware of other passengers.
6-Keep your phone charged and have the number for local emergency services readily available.
7-Be mindful of how much personal information you share online and in person.
8-Be cautious when interacting with strangers, especially in isolated areas.
9-Save important phone numbers in your contacts, including family, friends, and local authorities.

11-Stay in the areas where network connectivity is good.
12-Keep mobile balance sufficient to send message or call in emergency situation.
